intro: Arcteranthis, commonly known as the Arctic bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere, where it thrives in cold, rocky environments. The plant produces showy blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Arcteranthis plays an important ecological role in its habitat by contributing to biodiversity and providing food for local wildlife.
